channel.title: AWS Certified ML - Specialty exam (MLS-C01) on Ayush Subedi
channel.description: Recent content in AWS Certified ML - Specialty exam (MLS-C01) on Ayush Subedi

item.title: AWS Certified ML - Specialty exam (MLS-C01) - 1. Data Engineering (WIP)
item.description:
Data Engineering

  1. S3
  2. Kinesis
  3. Glue
  4. Redshift
  5. RDS
  6. DynamoDB
  7. OpenSearch
  8. AWS Data Pipeline
  9. AWS Batch
  10. AWS DMS
  11. Step Functions
  12. EFS
  13. EBS
  14. EMR
  15. Misc

item.title: AWS Certified ML - Specialty exam (MLS-C01) - 2. Exploratory Data Analysis (WIP)
item.description:
Exploratory Data Analysis

  1. Python in data science and machine learning
  2. Types of Data
  3. Data Distributions
  4. Trends and seasonality
  5. Athena
  6. Quicksight
  7. Types of visualization
  8. EMR
  9. Hadoop
  10. Apache Spark
  11. EMR Notebooks, Security and Instance Types
  12. Feature Engineering
  13. Imputing Missing Data
  14. Unbalanced Data
  15. Handling Outliers
  16. Binning, Transoforming, Encoding, Scaling, and Shuffling
  17. Amazon Sagemaker Ground Truth and Label Generation
  18. Misc

item.title: AWS Certified ML - Specialty exam (MLS-C01) - 3. Modeling (WIP)
item.description:
Modeling

  1. Activation Functions
  2. Convolutional Neural Network
  3. Recurrent Neural Networks
  4. Modern NLP with BERT and GPT, and Transfer Learning
  5. Deep Learning on EC2 and EMR
  6. Tuning Neural Networks
  7. Regularization Techniques for Neural Networks (Dropout, Early Stopping)
  8. L1 and L2 Regularization
  9. Grief with Gradients The Vanishing Gradient problem
  10. The Confusion Matrix
  11. Precision, Recall, F1, AUC, and more
  12. Ensemble Methods Bagging and Boosting
  13. Introducing Amazon SageMaker
  14. Linear Learner in SageMaker
  15. XGBoost in SageMaker
  16. Seq2Seq in SageMaker
  17. DeepAR in SageMaker
  18. BlazingText in SageMaker
  19. Object2Vec in SageMaker
  20. Object Detection in SageMaker
  21. Image Classification in SageMaker
  22. Semantic Segmentation in SageMaker
  23. Random Cut Forest in SageMaker
  24. Neural Topic Model in SageMaker
  25. Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) in SageMaker
  26. K-Nearest-Neighbors (KNN) in SageMaker
  27. K-Means Clustering in SageMaker
  28. Principal Component Analysis (PCA) in SageMaker
  29. Factorization Machines in SageMaker
  30. IP Insights in SageMaker
  31. Reinforcement Learning in SageMaker
  32. Automatic Model Tuning
  33. Apache Spark with SageMaker
  34. SageMaker Studio, and SageMaker Experiments
  35. SageMaker Debugger
  36. SageMaker Autopilot / AutoML
  37. SageMaker Model Monitor
  38. Other recent features (JumpStart, Data Wrangler, Features Store, Edge Manager)
  39. SageMaker Canvas
  40. Bias Measures in SageMaker Canvas
  41. SageMaker Training Compiler
  42. Amazon Comprehend
  43. Amazon Translate
  44. Amazon Transcribe
  45. Amazon Polly
  46. Amazon Rekognition
  47. Amazon Forecast
  48. Amazon Forecast Algorithms
  49. Amazon Lex
  50. Amazon Personalize
  51. Lightning round! TexTract, DeepLens, DeepRacher, Lookout, and Monitron
  52. TorchServe, AWS Neuron, and AWS Panorama
  53. Deep Composer, Fraud Detection, CodeGuru, and Contact Lens
  54. Amazon Kendra and Amazon Augmented AI (A2I)

item.title: AWS Certified ML - Specialty exam (MLS-C01) - 4. Machine Learning Implementation and Operations (WIP)
item.description:
Machine Learning Implementation and Operations

  1. Section Intro: Machine Learning Implementation and Operations
  2. SageMaker’s Inner Details and Production Variants
  3. SageMaker On the Edge: SageMaker Neo and IoT Greengrass
  4. SageMaker Security: Encryption at Rest and In Transit
  5. SageMaker Security: VPC’s, IAM, Logging, and Monitoring
  6. SageMaker Resource Management: Instance Types and Spot Training
  7. SageMaker Resource Management: Elastic Inference, Automatic Scaling, AZ’s
  8. SageMaker Serverless Inference and Inference Recommender
  9. SageMaker Inference Pipelines

item.title: Term Frequecy Inverse Document Frequency (TFIDF)
item.description:
Wikipedia search using TFIDF

Term Frequecy Inverse Document Frequency

please, call, the, number, below, do, not, us, please call, call the, the number, number below, please do, do not, not call, call us

dimension = [2, 16]

Example of unigram TFIDF

Imports

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import os
import pyspark
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.types import *
from pyspark.sql.functions import udf
from pyspark.ml.feature import HashingTF, IDF, Tokenizer

SparkSession

spark = SparkSession.builder \
    .appName('tfidf')\
    .config('spark.jars', '../jars/snowflake-jdbc-3.13.6.jar, ../jars/spark-snowflake_2.12-2.9.0-spark_3.1.jar') \
    .getOrCreate()
spark.sparkContext.setLogLevel("WARN")

22/12/27 13:35:58 WARN Utils: Your hostname, SPMBP136.local resolves to a loopback address: 127.0.0.1; using 192.168.0.101 instead (on interface en6)
22/12/27 13:35:58 WARN Utils: Set SPARK_LOCAL_IP if you need to bind to another address
22/12/27 13:35:59 WARN NativeCodeLoader: Unable to load native-hadoop library for your platform... using builtin-java classes where applicable


Setting default log level to "WARN".
To adjust logging level use sc.setLogLevel(newLevel). For SparkR, use setLogLevel(newLevel).

file_path = "../datasets/wiki.csv"

wiki = spark.read.format("csv").option("header", "true").load(file_path)

only showing top 20 rows

Search

def search_article(keyword):
    # get the hash val from keyword
    schema = StructType([StructField("words", ArrayType(StringType()))])
    temp = spark.createDataFrame(([[[keyword]]]), schema).toDF("words")
    temp_unhashed = hashingTF.transform(temp).select("rawFeatures").collect()
    val = int(temp_unhashed[0].rawFeatures.indices[0])
    #
    termExtractor = udf(lambda x:float(x[val]), FloatType())
    final = rescaledData.withColumn('score', termExtractor(rescaledData.features))
    final = final.filter("score>0").orderBy("score", ascending=False)
    return final.select('ID', 'Title', 'score')

search_article('mystery').show()
